title: What should I do if some famous researchers plagiarized my work and published it a few weeks before mine (one of them was a reviewer of my manuscript, which was submitted 1 year before theirs but had a 'prolonged' review period)? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’d look into what my university could do in this instance. I imagine there’d be a relatively involved process, and I’d want to have a pretty unimpeachable paper trail showing when I’d started work on the relevant project and how far along I’d got before the researcher in question got involved. Whether it would be a process worth pursuing would depend on what my university would advise me. It’s not going to be easy, we can agree, but it probably comes down to how complicated it would be.
